Reviews.Title: “CONVENIENT STOP OVER”
Reviews.Author: ELYTRAVELLERS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of a three week trip to discover the "real" Florida. We liked the cleanliness, size of rooms and the convenient location (easy access of the Florida Turnpike, adjacent to shops and restaurant and ten minutes to international airport). This is an above average typical USA hotel....very little character. The management were friendly and helpful. One thing we didn't like was the very abrupt breakfast finish and the attitude of the breakfast staff ..exactly at 0930hrs every breakfast "machine" was switched off and items cleared away with no warning...any requests for food were instantly dismissed....arriving at 0920hrs to a packed breakfast room meant very little breakfast available for us! One resident, who had been there for two weeks, told us that this happened every day...when we left we commented about this to the manager so hopefully this will improve.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Gary R
Reviews.Content: I booked this because of location and shopping, etc. close by.Well, never again.We arrived in the evening in our 1st of 8 days.We were given a handicapped acc. room.Because of this the bathroom was HUGE! and the rest of the room felt crampted and small. The next morning I asked if we could have another room because of the length of our stay we really needed a room with an easy chair.I was told the only way I could get a room with a chair was to book a suite.If we weren't meeting family members there later in the week, we would have left. When they did arrive with the same reservations, we found that all the rooms had a chair.Shame on you @ the front desk for lying!You got caught.Not only that,when you walk down the hall and housekeeping is cleaning you can see in the rooms and they had easy chairs! Guess you think one to be supid. SECOND, our toilet was clogged first use.The young lady who came up said she would have maintence look at it. Apparently not, had to call them 3 times! The first full day we began having problems getting he door to open once the card was put in the lock and the light turned green. At first thought it was me. But, everyone entering our room had the same problem. Told the front desk one evening when we were coming back in from our day of activities. He said ok-someone would look at it. Nothing done and nothing said about it. Then one day when I was struggling to get in one of the cleaning ladies helped me. The door knob was backwards and pushed up, instead of down like everywhere else I've stayed. All that would have been necessary was for someone to have told us this-there would have been no problem. As far as I'm concerned they do not care to make a guest's stay pleasant. Except for the young man that was on duty the night we checked in, the front desk peronel were less than pleasant. THIRD-The cleaning staff was impecable. The rooms were clean. Even smelled clean after they were in. I was very impressed to have a clean bedspread put on the bed after about 3 days. They were the only ones that deserve an "atta boy". Breakfast staff was ok. Not overly pleasant either. Other visits to this area we have stayed at Holiday Inn & Suies/Kendall Airport. I will go back there. They are pleasant, helpful. No problems with them. Great place. Though at the time we felt like it was away from things, it really isn't. Never again will I try a different motel in this area. HI has my vote! DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dadeland Mall Adventure”
Reviews.Author: Sharon W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made a weekend trip from Key West to Miami. I want to thank the entire staff especially Carmen and Luis for a wonderful room and quite stay, We enjoyed the hospitality and the young man who check us in was superior.(sorry I did not get his name). Our room was spotless and fresh. Great location to all the shopping areas and place to eat. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: aussiechic84
Reviews.Content: I stayed just this past weekend and had a great stay. I had been in contact with Carmen from sales, and she assured me that everything was set for my arrival. I had mentioned that I was visiting for my birthday weekend. Well after a long drive I was pleased to find when I entered my room to see a balloon and cupcake. Carmen went above and beyond to make me feel truely welcome to this property. The next morning I woke up early to enjoy breakfast, which I found really good and a perfect way to start the day. I truely enjoyed my stay, the breakfast was great, the rooms clean and spacious, the staff was friendly, and the property was in the perfect location for my travel needs. Thanks again to Carmen for making this a great birthday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out out of the way, but a solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatsTMill
Reviews.Content: Hotels in Miami are hard to find with a balance of price and value, but this one was. It had all that I look for in a hotel: solid breakfast, free parking, nice, clean rooms, and a great staff. it is a little far from Miami's main attractions (beach, etc.), but still a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable & Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: slk1692
Reviews.Content: While travelling for business, I stayed here for two nights! Not only was the facility clean and affordable, but was conveniently placed in front of a shopping plaza where you could purchase dinner or go to the grocery store to purchase groceries. There was also a chain pharmacy near by, thereby making a short walk from the hotel to the store incredibly accessible and convenient to everything important.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Upgrading”
Reviews.Author: traveltrini
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short business trip. Sorry to say I was really disappointed. The rooms need some upgrading. The sink area was on the outside of the bathroom, just as you enter the room, I found this to be a bit unsanitary. I was also dissatisfied with the breakfast service. The selection was typical, waffles, eggs, toast, fruit, cereal, juice. It also tasted okay. The lady clearing up breakfast was a little hasty. One morning a family with young children came in a little late for breakfast while she was clearing up. The mom asked if she can get some breakfast for her kids, the lady replied that breakfast is over and starting emptying leftover food items into the garbage. In my opinion she could have been a little more accomodating. Overall the hotel is in a good location within a strip mall, and closeby to shopping, and it is also afforable.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Homestead Miami Speedway Visit”
Reviews.Author: NYTriper
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel to attend the Ford Championship weekend at Homestead. The hotel was about a half hour from the airport and half hour from the track, making it a good location. The hotel is at the end of a shopping plaza with just about everything you need in walking distance. Free breakfast in the morning, and not just a continental breakfast. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jean11431
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times. The location is good and the people are friendly and helpful. Good breakfast. I would love for the rooms to be a little larger, but understand it was renovated from another brand hotel and Country Inn could only work with the walls they inherited!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nadia B
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had just returned from a cruise and decided to spend the night in Miami. We looked up a few hotels in the area and decided to go to this hotel. It was easy to find, and the hotel looked nice from the outside. We went in and were very politely greeted by a gentleman at the front desk. We asked to see a room before making the reservation. The gentleman kindly showed us around and explained the ammenities available to us. We were very pleased with the room and the hotel. It was very clean, the room was spacious, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Also, the breakfast was delicious!!! I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Miami and I would 100% stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wisowepa
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price and type. The Hotel staff is great, it would be an awesome Hotel if the Wifi would work faster and the bathroom exhaust fan was not so loud.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Stay”
Reviews.Author: thepteam08
Reviews.Content: I live here in Miami and I stayed at this hotel because my mom wanted some time off to relax. The service at this hotel is absolutely great, especially from a front desk agent Hatem. Let me tell you, we are not the easiest family to deal with and he has so much patience and kindness that I was really impressed. I am a front desk agent myself and it would be an honor if I had a co worker like him. Great job! I will recommend this hotel to everyone. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly good”
Reviews.Author: fmglez
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel frequently and I always have a good stay. The rooms are clean and staff is friendly. Location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Skydiva2800
Reviews.Content: As a flight crew member I have stayed at many hotels. I love this Country Inn, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and plesant. One reviewer claimed she was bitten by bedbugs. I stay at this hotel every week and have yet to encounter any bedbug problems. Its close 2 malls as well as a movie theater. I woud recommend this hotel to anyone wanting an inexpensive yet nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Ruboid123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2011 - May 6 we had a lovely stay & early breakfast - no problems. However, May 13 was a different story. I was travelling with my cousin & her granddaughter so we got a room with 2 queen beds. I was hoping for the same nice night we'd had on the way down to Key West. I woke in the middle of the night because I was being bitten by bedbugs. I had bites on my neck, arms, legs. Having severe allergies, I react quickly to bites otherwise it would have been another 24 hours before anything became evident. My cousin & I were able to take precautions and everything we took into the room came out in plastic bags & was put into a dryer when we returned home. That took care of the problem. The manager was very gracious and did not charge for the night. I've since contacted the head office to tell them the problem & hope to hear back from them soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: anaranjo12345
Reviews.Content: This is not definitely a hotel for a Business traveler, Internet access is worse than in the Third world. Not able to download a 1 mb file, had to go to an starbucks coffee nearby. Staff was friendly. Newspaper was not delivered to the room as advertised either. Room is OK, i found this place a little bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you are interested in a clean, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: southflmama
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Miami Zoo. We should have chosen another 'suite-type' hotel despite the drive to the Zoo. The 'suite' we received seemed smaller than a regular guest room with a bizarre lower ceiling, no windows and a very strange layout that made it more difficult to accomodate our family of 4. The breakfast was abysmal complete with canned fruit cocktail and watery oatmeal. Awful. The furniture was stained and uncomfortable. The pool was out of commission for some reason. The property was surrounded by cats and a thick ring of cigarette butts. Had other hotels nearby had 2 rooms (as we had friends a few doors down) available we would have changed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Just right - as always!”
Reviews.Author: Faros
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Country Inn & Suites a few times, and, as always, it was a very comfortable stay. It's in the Kendall area of Miami, so this is not a resort area. It's a suburban area, near shopping centers and malls... and convenient to visit family in the area. Rooms are comfortable, service is consistent. Breakfast is acceptable, but usually crowded. Excellent rates through their website and getting a non-cancellation package. If you are looking for excellent price and this area works for you. this hotel is comfortable and definitely worth staying and coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsBo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Country Inn and Suites while visiting family nearby. The lobby was welcoming and comfortable. A bookshelf had been set up with books that guests could read while staying in the hotel. The check-in process was quick and easy. Cookies were available on the counter. The room was very comfortable with a nice view of the lake and fountain of the adjoining shopping center. Although the room was tucked around by the elevator we heard no noise from it during our stay. Breakfast was good. It had the usual cereals, pastries, bagels, fruits but also had make-it-yourself waffles which were tasty. The seating area was a little cramped but clean. Rooms had WiFi, a small refrigerator, microwave and safe. There was a computer in the lobby for guest to use. When we are back in the area visiting family we will certainly choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: bork3000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not terrible, but you can get the same and better for less money (paid $100 for a room) - Limited breakfast (even for what these "breakfasts" usually are). - Somewhat worn out bed - getting a bit too soft in the middle. - Room was marginally clean (with dirt in places just out of easy reach, like corners) - Housekeeping came at 9:20, knocked at the door and began opening it before I had a chance to reply. Good thing there was a latch on. They left and came knocking right back at 9:35! Not cool. - Rooms facing the parking lot are very noisy and street light shines into your window all night. You may have more luck if your room faces the backyard, I guess. Bottom line - spend a few minutes and you'll find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convenient Location with very Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SDB_SI
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel this year. My first trip was with my husband and we enjoyed the pool, on site gym, continental breakfast and the use of the 24 Hour Fitness Center located in the shopping plaza, courtesy of the hotel. My second trip was an emergency trip and the hotel staff were very sensitive to my situation and accommodated an extended stay. The staff is very friendly, imformative and helpful. It is conveniently located off the highway in at the end of a very nice mall and the area offers plenty of choices of restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suburban hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cawowyn
Reviews.Content: Live in Miami and stayed at this hotel while our house was being tented. Had to add another night after we checked in, was not a problem since it was during the week. Desk staff is very friendly and always greeted us by name when we came through the door. The room was okay and included a small refrigerator and microwave. There was only a desk chair in the room. Would have liked a comfortable chair for reading. A/C was a bit noisy. Breakfast was okay but not as nice as some places I have stayed. This hotel is located in a shopping center with a Kohl's and Nordstrom Rack. There are also several places within walking distance to eat including an Outback. A Blue Martini nightclub opened recently. Within a few miles either way on Kendall Drive there are probably 20 restaurants. There was one computer in the lobby for guests but was always occupied, they do have wireless internet in the rooms. This hotel is about 15 miles southwest of downtown Miami and about and hour west of Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, but...”
Reviews.Author: travelingrammy_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our grandchildren to Miami for 8 days. We stayed at this hotel because it had good reviews on TA, and because it could accomodate us all --2 adults, 4 children ages 11, 9, 6 and 3. We have been on many trips with these children, to various locations in the US, and never encountered this problem before. After the first night, my oldest grandaughter announced she had been bitten by something. We had been to the pool, and out and about in hot, hot hot Miami, so I dismissed it. She kept getting more bites...no one else did, After we had been there 4 nights, her brothers discovered an insect on the fold-out sofa bed (she and her little sister had slept on this bed the night before--only one night. My husband killed the insect andsaved the evidence. I went downstairs and did some research on the hotel computer. WALA! We had bedbugs! I told the manager(who did not at first admit to being the manager) very quietly, because at the time I was not sure how I was going to handle the situation. We agreed to move to another floor in the hotel because I was not sure we could find accomodations for the rest of our stay, AND, I guess I was hoping for the best. We also were given 3 days off our bill. We did not see any more evidence of the little critters. However, I could not enjoy the rest of the stay because I kept wondering if I had made the right decision for my family. When we arrived home, the childrens' mother noticed several bites on the 2 little boys, which did not come until the evening of the day we returned home. Their doctor informed us that sometimes you will not see bites until as much as 24 hours after being bit. The real reason I decided to blow the whistle on this hotel is, I'm afraid there might have been bugs in the SECOND room, also!!! On another note: The breakfast was not spectacular AND the living room configuration in both rooms made it impossibe to get around the room when the bed was out---a fire hazard, I'm sure. In the second room, we moved the furniture around so we could get around the room when the bed was out.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a few improvements would make it perfect”
Reviews.Author: eavega
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights over the Memorial Day weekend. We have two little ones (4 and 5) that go to bed very early, so we appreciate a hotel room with a separate bedroom so my wife and I don't have to go dark and quiet at 8 PM. In that respect, the hotel was great. The room was configured with a separate living room and a bedroom with a real door in between. The room itself was a little awkwardly shaped. The living room was long an narrow with the TV at one end, and a sofa at the other. The TV was small-ish (about a 20 in widescreen) and was about 15 feet from the sofa, so TV watching was odd at best. The room did have the Bathroom off of the Living Room instead of the Bedroom, so that is another plus in our situation. The room also had a refrigerator, a microwave, and a coffee maker, so we were able to keep food in our room and heat up stuff for the girls to eat. The breakfast was a bit lacking, in my opinion. Most hotels now have the waffle maker, so that is not a big deal. Aside from waffles, your choice was cereal (3 types), yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, sausages that you had to heat yourself in the microwave, toast, and bagels, and a basket of oranges and apples. There was milk and a variety of juices. Better than nothing, but I have seen better at less expensive hotels. Their coffee is hotel-standard Maxwell House, which in my opinion is awful. They did also have a small selection of teas (mostly chamomile). The Fitness room consisted of a treadmill, a bike, and an elliptical trainer. That was it. The location was absolutely great! without having to leave the mall parking lot, you had several options for food (including a pretty good Cuban restaurant), as well as a Publix and a CVS. The location is convenient to the Turnpike, and just off of Kendall Drive which is a major East-West artery in the Kendall area. You are less than 30 min from the beaches, and about an hour out of the Keys. All in all, for our type of travel to Miami which involves visiting a lot of family, with an occasional trip to the beach, this location is great. The room rate was also very reasonable given that it was a holiday weekend. The staff was very friendly, especially the front desk staff. I would definitely return again for my next stay in Miami unless the rates start going up.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDog08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business, and the hotel met our needs. Staff was friendly, room clean, and my room had a fridge and microwave. Breakfast was good, what you would expect from a continental breakfast. Close to several restaurants within about a mile drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: larsenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. The room was very comfortable. The front desk called our room soon after we checked in to see if we needed anything. The windows could not be opened, so we had to rely on the air conditioning. Breakfast of waffles and cereal was good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate”
Reviews.Author: BunnyGirl1957
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this motel for two nights over Super Bowl weekend because our usual hotel, the Marriott Dadeland, was unavailable. We found it to be perfectly adequate - nothing special about it, but the staff was very nice and helpful and the room was spotless. Only two complaints - it is a little difficult to find if you don't know the area and don't have mapquest available - it's not on the main street and can not be seen from it. Also, the TV was set as an alarm clock, which we did not realize, and on the first morning of our stay we were awakened with a loud "Hello" and lots of light and we thought someone had entered our room. Make sure you disable that feature! The room was expensive for what it was, but it was Super Bowl weekend and all the hotels in Miami were double their usual price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, hospitable, and a good value”
Reviews.Author: ysnkaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one Saturday night here while we visited our son at college. There was nothing out of the ordinary about it, but it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and a decent size. We didn't make use of them, but there was a refrigerator and microwave in the room. Wireless internet also. One thing important to me is that our hallway was quiet. The bed was comfortable, although I thought the pillows were a bit flimsy. There is an outdoor pool and there was a small workout room on our floor. The continental breakfast was fine...waffles, bagels, hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, etc. I also thought the location was good. It's right near the highway, next to a shopping area. Convenient but still quiet. Generally, a great value and I would definitely stay there again the next time we're in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: SwapnaMurari
Reviews.Content: We were here for the sep long weekend..for 3 nights..place was pretty good...clean rooms wid gud room service..this place is located few miles away from south beach ( 30 min drive) as well to everglades national park..this was the main reason for opting this hotel..there is a mall next to this place..they even provided internet..they served th continentalin breakfast..in short a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great locaion”
Reviews.Author: Kruth
Reviews.Content: Standard Country Inn & Suites hotel in a good location --- within a shopping complex & next to highway. Reasonably priced for Miami area. Nice pool, which we usually had to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in SW Miami”
Reviews.Author: Viajes29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed three nights in this hotel. We got a very good deal, our room was beautiful, very clean with a refrigerator, microwave and safe. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. A very nice free breakfast was included. They have a computer with internet access in the lobby plus a lending library and complimentary cookies at the front desk. We enjoyed eating breakfast overlooking the lake. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone in the Kendall (SW) area of Miami. It is very close to the Florida Turnpike and located at the entrance to a big shopping center with lots of restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ilovemiamiyami
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 days during the Memorial Day Weekend and were extremely impressed with every aspect of this hotel. The staff was excellent - very friendly and accommodating from the front desk to the housekeeping. The lobby was bright and welcoming with a cozy feel to it. It had a computer for guests to use (free), a bookshelf with books that guests could borrow during their stay and a small tray of cookies at the front desk. Our room was extremely clean, climate controlled, nicely decorated and spacious. In the bathroom, we each had our "private little giggle" as we discovered that the full length mirror was hanging on the door directly facing the toilet (sorry, I had to throw that in : ) Free breakfast is included and it was one of the best complementary breakfasts that I've seen offered by any hotel we've ever stayed at - they had a nice selection of cereals, juices, muffins, hard boiled eggs, fresh fruits and you can even make your own waffles! The breakfast bar was always tended to and stocked. The neighborhood that the hotel is located in is a combination of a shopping plaza (Publix, CVS and post office to name of few stores), office buildings and some residential housing. We felt safe the entire time we were there. Parking at the hotel is free, and there were plenty of spaces. We've found our favorite hotel in Miami, and since we go back numerous times throughout the year, we will definitely be staying at County Inn and Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good rooms, fine breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Rocks19
Reviews.Content: We had to stay in Miami for over a week at a place near the Baptist Hospital and were very glad we found the Country Inn. I read the negative reviews from 2006 and the place must have made a complete turn-around since then, I know it has changed ownership and management. It was super clean, everything worked, the staff was friendly and professional. Free parking (a real plus in Miami), free breakfast, free coffee and cookies all day, and free USA Today. The entire motel is NON-SMOKING, no exceptions. The near-by mall was only half finished with a complete refurbishing when we were there, but had several decent restaurants and a Publix super market. Many other good places to eat within a short drive. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, good deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: MVFlyer
Reviews.Content: Country Inn & Suites in Kendall is a very nice motor lodge. The folks working there were very nice and helpful; the place was spotless; and had a pretty nice breakfast (fresh waffles, hard boiled eggs, yogurts, cereals, fruit, breads). Room was very nice and comfortable as well, and the place has fast Wi-fi in all the rooms. Highly recommended if you're going to the Everglades or other places in south Florida.

Reviews.Title: “the most comfy beds!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JOYNIN
Reviews.Content: Used to be Wellesly Inn AND HAS HAD A COMPLETE MAKEOVER.The beds are sooooooooooo soft and comfortable!!! My room had a king size bed ,desk with chair AND a comfy chaise lounge.I used to stay in a suite when it was Wellesly but since I only stayed one night I didn't need it,but i imagine they are very nice now.Mangement were so nice and friendly. I have absolutely no complaints and want to congratulate them on such a good job. Town and Country Mall is being re- built , still has a Publix, Marshalls,Men's Wearhouse,other small shoes and clothes stores and a few small restaurantsand a brand new medical center will be opening soon right across from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not worth the money. First, the wesite we used to search for hotels had pictures that are not of this hotel. When I inquired about this, I was told that the pictures are submitted by the hotel. Apparently they put up pictures of a new and clean hotel to mislead the buying public. Our decision to use this hotel was that the pictures and description indicated good price performance. That is not the case! The hotel was not really clean although it smelled of disinfectant. Our television did not work and we had to make them switch it out. This would be a good $50 hotel in that you get what you pay for. As for this hotel, you do not get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out for me”
Reviews.Author: equipesom
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel and it was pleasant. Sorry the previous member had problems with the bathroom etc. but if you call the front desk and explain, I am sure they would have put you in another room. It is a good hotel for the price. In Miami the hotels are VERY EXPENSIVE and this one is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToLAsoon
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and would not stay there again. We did not arrive until around 10:00 pm and found that the television did not work, but didn't report it because we were tired. The next morning, the toilet overflowed. When we tried calling the front desk, we realized that the room phone did not work. I used my cell phone to call the front desk to report the toilet overflowing, that the television did not work and that the room phone did not work. I asked them to call me back and give us a key to another room so that we could shower. A few minutes later the room phone rings but I could not answer it because, as I had just told them, it didn't work. Again I used my cell phone to call the front desk. After much agony, we were given a key to the room next to us to shower. That room had not been cleaned but the housekeeper did clean the bathroom so that we could shower and leave. I was given a room discount upon by checking out but I believe that this room should not have been made available at all.

Reviews.Title: “Ugg!!”
Reviews.Author: Realguy
Reviews.Content: Not very nice, not very clean, overwhelming smell of disinfectant. Go to Hampton Inn Dadeland or the Marriott if you need to stay in Kendall.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay and staff is untrained”
Reviews.Author: Mymzee
Reviews.Content: First I asked for a non smoking room. The entire floor smelled like an ashtray, not to mention my room. When I called the front desk, the clerk told me that since I booked trough Expedia I am not guaranteed what I asked for and there is nothing she could do. I even told her that she did not have to make me feel like booking through Expedia is a negative thing. She said they were sold out. In any event, there were three pillows for two of us all flat of course, but at least one of us had two pillows, the in room fridge made so much noise we had to unplug it. The ashtray still had ashes in it. The front desk clerk, did not confirm any details with me upon check in nor did she upon check out (I believe it was the same clerk), initially gave me the wrong key, did not give me any information on the property or surrounding areas and gave me attitude instead of trying to help me with my problem. I suggest Expedia not use this hotel as one of your products or at least train them to not make negative remarks about Expedia. I feel that if I would have booked directly through them and spent the extra $14 I would have been given the room I asked for and had a restful night's sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Country Inn & Suites Miami (Kendall)
HotelInfo.Address: 11750 Mills Drive, Miami, FL 33183
